Class Team

java.lang.Object
Monster
Team
All Implemented Interfaces:
Purchasable
public class Team extends Monster
This class creates a new object Team The team holds the player's/ trainer's Monsters.
Version:
1.0
Author:
Angelo Gasmin

      Returns:

    • addFriend

      public boolean addFriend(Monster friend)
      Returns true or false. Returns true if the given monster was successfully added into the team.
      Parameters:
      friend - The monster to be added
      Returns:
      boolean for if the given monster was successfully added to the team

    • removeFriend

      public boolean removeFriend(Monster friend)
      Returns true or false. Returns true if the given monster was successfully removed.
      Parameters:
      friend - The monster to be removed
      Returns:
      boolean for if the given monster was successfully removed from the team

    • buyMonster

      public void buyMonster(int monsterNum, Shop shop, Player player)
      Adds a monster to the party. Deducts money from the player accordingly.
      Parameters:
      monsterNum - The index of the number in the shop
      shop - The shop, used to get the list of randomMonsters
      player - The player

    • sellMonster

      public void sellMonster(int MonsterNum, int costIndex, Shop shop, Player player)
      Removes a monster from the party. Gives money to the player accordingly.
      Parameters:
      MonsterNum - The index of the monster to be sold
      costIndex - The index of the monsters selling price
      shop - The shop, used to get the list of selling prices
      player - The player

    • printFriends

      public String printFriends()
      Returns the monsters in the team as a String. This includes their name and their stats.
      Returns:
      a String of monsters

    • swap

      public void swap(int index1, int index2)
      Swaps the position of two monsters in your party.
      Parameters:
      index1 - The first monster to be swapped
      index2 - The second monster to be swapped

    • pushFrontToBack

      public void pushFrontToBack()
      Pushes the first monster to the last index in the team. Each other monster is pushed one spot ahead.

    • sumTeamHealth

      public double sumTeamHealth()
      Returns the sum of all monsters' health in the team
      Returns:
      an integer of the sum of all of the monster's healths that are in the team

      public String toString()
      Returns the team in string form.

      toString in class Monster
      Returns:
